Yes, it's concerning when companies prioritize cost-cutting over safety, especially in industries like aviation where the consequences of safety failures can be catastrophic. It's important for companies like Boeing to be held accountable for their actions and to learn from their mistakes to prevent similar situations from happening in the future.

Boeing’s recent issues with the 737 MAX have highlighted the need for greater accountability and oversight in the aviation industry. The company must take steps to listen to feedback from customers, regulators, and other stakeholders, and make necessary changes to its processes to ensure that safety is never compromised.

Furthermore, Boeing must acknowledge the role that it plays in ensuring safety in the broader aviation industry. They must lead by example and set a standard of safety that other manufacturers must follow. There is a great need for transparency, collaboration, and information sharing to ensure that safety is never again compromised for economic reasons. 

We hope that companies like Boeing prioritize safety over profits and learn from their mistakes, so the aviation industry can remain safe and reliable in the years to come.
